content:
This >100 file PR is likely to go stale quite quickly (or worse, start to have files ported from underneath it and gain forward-porting obligations).

The overview of the change is that it redefines disjoint s t from s ⊓ t ≤ ⊥ to ∀ ⦃x⦄, x ≤ s → x ≤ t → x ≤ ⊥, in doing so supporting cases when no lattice is available, or when defining has_inf would require decidability assumptions.
I am in favour of this change.
I don't particularly want to read this PR, but, ... I'm tempted to merge on the basis of these two comments.
If no one objects, and I haven't done this by tomorrow, ping me here and I'll do it. :-)
Probably most of the review belongs in order/bounded.lean and data/finset/basic.lean. The rest is just fixing proofs that relied on the old defeq
For what it's worth, I looked at this PR and thought it was a good change, but didn't feel I had enough knowledge to be sure to merge it, so I was waiting for other comments.
